thread.section_title: Jamie Vardy insists he has no regrets over snubbing Arsenal and Arsene Wenger in the summer – Metro
thread.title: Jamie Vardy insists he has no regrets over snubbing Arsenal and Arsene Wenger in the summer
thread.title_full: Jamie Vardy insists he has no regrets over snubbing Arsenal and Arsene Wenger in the summer

author: jsgoldman
title: Jamie Vardy insists he has no regrets over snubbing Arsenal and Arsene Wenger in the summer
text:
Arsenal activated Jamie Vardy’s release clause last summer before he decided to commit to Leicester City (Picture: Getty Jamie Vardy insists he has no regrets over snubbing a move to Arsenal last summer.
Wenger 'furious' with Ozil and ready to sell him after latest slap in the face The England striker was coveted by Arsene Wenger following his exploits during Leicester City’s unprecedented Premier League triumph.
Wenger submitted a £20 million bid for the 30-year-old, activating his release clause in the process, but Vardy opted to remain at the King Power Stadium and signed a new long-term contract instead of joining the Gunners.
Jamie Vardy revealed he received death threats following the sacking of former Leicester manager Claudio Ranieri (Picture: Getty) Jamie Vardy has returned to form in recent weeks scoring four goals in his last five games (Picture: Getty) The former Fleetwood striker had struggled for goals until recently, with a change in manager triggering a return to his best form.
Vardy, who has scored four goals in his last five games in all competitions, revealed he received death threats following Claudio Ranieri’s sacking, but he believes a move to Arsenal wouldn’t have seen him maintain his form of last season.
Arsenal fixtures Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 apr
Manchester City (N) FA Cup – Sun 23 Apr
Tottenham (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Manchester United (H) – Sat 6 May
Stoke (A) – Sat 13 May
‘If I’d played like that I would have been in the same situation there, so no,’ he said when asked if he regretted his decision. ‘No, not at all.
‘The main thing was not to let it get you down. That is the worst thing – then you will just never want to go on the pitch again. So you just have to keep working hard.
More: Football Arsenal shareholders worth DOUBLE Chelsea owner Roman Abramovic 
Confirmed: Man Utd ace seals transfer away - could leave Old Trafford next week 
Surprise Man Utd ace set for new deal after makling huge strides under Mourinho 
‘If you keep working at the things that worked well in the past there is a point where they will come around and start working for you again.
‘It was hard but that has started to happen. We have started to pick the wins up and dragged ourselves away from the relegation zone.’
MORE: New figures show leading Arsenal shareholders worth DOUBLE Chelsea owner Roman Abramovic
